cab.content: This document is the property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.SECRET.WAR CABINET.ALLIED TROOPS IN THE MEANDER VALLEY.MEMORANDUM BY THE SECRETARY OF STATE FOR WAR.I circulate a copy of a letter sent by the Army Council to the Foreign Office, relative to a decision arrived at by the Peace Conference on 7 th October, that Allied troops were to be sent to the Meander Valley.I trust that my colleagues will endorse the opinion of the Army Council that it is most inadvisable to commit British troops in the Meander Valley.WINSTON S. CHURCHILL.23rd October, 1919.sir, 14th October, 1919.I am commanded by the Army Council to refer to Sir Eyre Crowe's telegram No. 1426 of the 9th October, relative to the proposed employment of a British force in that portion of the Meander Valley which is not to remain in exclusively Greek occupation.I am to say that the Council deprecate most strongly the use of British troops in this they consider it impossible to gauge the extent to which they may be committed by an occupation of this nature.I am to add that the Council consider it essential that General Milne's status in Asia Minor should be defined clearly in terms which are recognized by the other Powers concerned.lam, Sir,Your obedient servant,(Signed) B. B. Cubitt.The Under Secretary of State, Foreign Office.(Bl 9/479) 70 10/19 h&S 7605wo
